intro: Silene hitchguirei, commonly known as the Hitchcock's catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, characterized by its showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain seeds. Silene hitchguirei is a perennial herb that is relatively rare and of conservation concern in its native range.
